docs.lead_paragraph: The bride and groom have run directly from their wedding without bothering to change their clothes or go on their honeymoon, to the appliance store. The salesman is telling the groom (not the bride) how terrific the G.E. Toaster-Oven is.

headline.main: NOW Says: TV Commercials Insult Women; TV commercials insult women

docs.abstract: Natl Orgn for Women (NOW) leaders J A Hennessee and J Nicholson article charges TV commercials insult women, depicting them in stereotyped roles of housewife-mother and sex objects; describes NOW legal action against WABC-TV on charges of discrimination against women in employment, failure to ascertain women's needs and interests in programming and violation of FCC Fairness Doctrine, which requires that both sides of important issues be presented; illus of abusive TV commercials; cartoons show how women are portrayed in 1,200 ads monitored by NOW in course of 1 1/2 yrs
docs.snippet: The bride and groom have run directly from their wedding without bothering to change their clothes or go on their honeymoon, to the appliance store. The salesman is telling the groom (not the bride) how terrific the G.E. Toaster-Oven is.

byline.original: By JUDITH ADLER HENNESSEE and JOAN NICHOLSON
